meanings.definition: To gaze at someone with desire.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help letching at him during the party.
meanings.sent2: He was letching at the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was letching at the delicious treat on the table.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be letching at the bright sun above.
meanings.sent5: The child was letching at the colorful toys in the store window.

meanings.sent1: The garbage was letching in the hot summer sun.
meanings.sent2: The old shoes were letching in the closet.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk was letching in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The stagnant water was letching in the abandoned pool.
meanings.sent5: The rotten fruit was letching in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A feeling of intense desire or longing.
meanings.sent1: She felt a deep letching for adventure.
meanings.sent2: His letching for success drove him to work hard.
meanings.sent3: The letching for knowledge kept her reading late into the night.
meanings.sent4: The letching for freedom burned within her heart.
meanings.sent5: Their letching for each other was evident in every glance.
